text: Georgi Slavkov (; April 11, 1958 – January 21, 2014) was a Bulgarian football player. Slavkov scored 61 goals in 112 games for Trakia between 1976 and 1982. With CSKA Sofia he played between 1982 and 1986, scoring 48 goals. Then he was transferred to the French club AS Saint-Étienne. He finished his career in Portugal in 1992. Between 1978 and 1983, he won 37 caps for Bulgaria and scored 11 goals. Georgi Slavkov died suddenly on Jan 21, 2014 in Plovdiv after suffering a heart attack at the age of 55. ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Botev Plovdiv * Bulgarian Cup: 1980–81 ;CSKA Sofia * A Group (2): 1979–80, 1982–83 * Bulgarian Cup: 1984–85 * Cup of the Soviet Army (2): 1984–85, 1985–86 === Individual === * A Group Top Scorer: 1980–81 (31 goals) * European Golden Shoe: 1981 ==References== ==Other websites== *Profile at National-Football- Teams Category:1958 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Bulgarian footballers Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Disease-related deaths in Bulgaria
title: Georgi Slavkov
